snippet: A judge on the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court had suggested that no company raised any legal concerns about the bulk collection of its customers’ calling records.
abstract: Declassified documents from Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court say that in 2009 and 2010, a telephone company raised questions about legality of then-secret National Security Agency program that is systematically collecting records of Americans' calling habits.
lead_paragraph: A judge on the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court had suggested that no company raised any legal concerns about the bulk collection of its customers’ calling records.

headline.main: Phone Company Pushed Back Against N.S.A.’s Data Collection, Court Papers Show
headline.print_headline: Phone Company Pushed Back Against N.S.A.’s Data Collection, Court Papers Show
